content.description: Dr. Handler conducted research to explore the extent to which hearing acuity changes with age. She tested the absolute threshold for hearing in 10 subjects of various ages. The results are presented in the table.
content.question: Subject Age Highest frequency of sound detected <math alttext="in hertz" overflow="scroll"><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mtext>Hz</mtext></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded></math> 1 15 18,000 2 65 10,500 3 45 13,250 4 80 8,000 5 18 17,500 6 35 15,000 7 55 11,500 8 26 22,000 9 63 9,400 10 41 16,300 Which of the following is an appropriate conclusion based on the data presented in the table?

choices.label: There is no relationship between age and pitch perception.
There is a causal relationship between age and pitch perception.
As age increases, the ability to detect higher pitched sounds tends to decrease.
No conclusions can be drawn because the subjects were not randomly assigned.

content.answer: As age increases, the ability to detect higher pitched sounds tends to decrease.

skill.text: 3.C: Interpret quantitative or qualitative inferential data from a given table, graph, chart, figure, or diagram.
